    • Sampling Aware Ancestral State Inference

    Estimate birth-death-sampling parameters

    estimate_bds_parameters.Rd

    Estimates lambda (speciation rate) and psi (sampling rate) for a phylogenetic tree. The function enforces epidemiological constraints including R0 bounds and infectious period limits.

    estimate_bds_parameters(
  phy,
  mu,
  trim = c(0.1, 0.5),
  n_starts = 100,
  force_two_step = FALSE,
  psi_max = 7,
  r0_min = 1,
  r0_max = 5,
  infectious_period_min = NULL,
  infectious_period_max = NULL
)

    Arguments

    phy

    A phylo object with branch lengths. Must be rooted and binary.

    mu

    Fixed extinction rate (required)

    trim

    Numeric vector of length 2 specifying quantiles for trimming node times in LTT. Default c(0.10, 0.50).

    n_starts

    Number of starting points for multi-start optimization. Default 100.

    force_two_step

    Logical. If TRUE, uses two-step estimates even if they violate constraints. Default FALSE.

    psi_max

    Maximum sampling rate per unit time. Default 7.

    r0_min

    Minimum basic reproductive number (R0 = lambda/(mu+psi)). Default 1.

    r0_max

    Maximum basic reproductive number. Default 5.

    infectious_period_min

    Minimum infectious period (1/(mu+psi)). Default NULL.

    infectious_period_max

    Maximum infectious period (1/(mu+psi)). Default NULL.

    Value

    An object of class "bds_estimate" containing:

    • lambda: Estimated speciation rate

    • psi: Estimated sampling rate

    • mu: Fixed death rate (input)

    • r0: Estimated basic reproductive number (lambda/(mu+psi))

    • infectious_period: Estimated infectious period

    • method: Estimation method used ("two_step_constrained", "mle_constrained", or "two_step_forced")

    • a: Net diversification rate (lambda - mu - psi) from LTT

    • b: Ratio lambda/(mu + psi) from MLE

    • n_tips: Number of tips in the tree

    • n_nodes: Number of internal nodes

    • mle_fit: Full MLE fit object from step 1

    • constraints: List of constraint parameters used

    Details

    The estimation proceeds in two steps:

    1. Maximum likelihood estimation with fixed mu to get estimates for (lambda/(mu+psi))

    2. Using lineage-through-time plot to estimate net diversification rate (lambda - mu - psi)

    With mu known, we can estimate lambda and psi using the above estimates.

    If the two-step method produces estimates that violate constraints or is numerically unstable, the function falls back to the MLE estimates from step 1.

    Contents

    Developed by Ivan Gill, Yexuan Song.
